formdata.value:
PHP is a server scripting language, and a powerful tool for making dynamic and interactive Web pages.

PHP is a widely-used, free, and efficient alternative to competitors such as Microsoft's ASP.

formdata.description: Required. Alpha numeric and some special chars allowed

formdata.value:
JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language.

JavaScript is the programming language of the Web.

JavaScript is easy to learn.

This tutorial will teach you JavaScript from basic to advanced.

formdata.description:
Required
Accepted values= evaluated, practice, quiz
Default = evaluated

formdata.value: Describe a normal school day in the life of a student in your country including hours, class subjects, meals, rules, dress, and extra-curricular activities. What options are there in your country to take online classes through distance learning, even for children?

request.description:
This API will create a new test and return test GUID. Input parameters are

**title**: required, alpha-numeric with punctuations (- , _ ' " ), minimum length 1, max length 200 characters

**details**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**instructions**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**status**: 0 = Unpublished, 1 = Published, 2 = Archived

**created_by**: user guid

default value is 1. accepted values are
0 = inactive
1 = active
2 = archived

Accepted values
newest_first
newest_last
title_desc
title_asc - (default

Filter result by test type. Accepted values are-
practice, evaluated, quiz

request.description:
StartFragment

This API will return a list of all tests based on the search criteria. As input it takes following form parameters:

- **results_per_page**- records to be returned. Used for pagination. Default value is 15
- **search**- text to be searched. Used for a full text search in fields Test title, details.
- **page**- page number for pagination. Default value 1.
- **order_by**- accepted values
    - newest_first
    - newest_last
    - title_desc
    - title_asc - (default)
- **status**- default value is 1. accepted values are
    - 0 = inactive
    - 1 = active
    - 2 = archived

response.name: Search and filter tests

formdata.value: Select the correct adverb or adjective that can be inserted in the blank space. Also identify if the selected item is adverb or adjective.

formdata.description:
Required
Accepted values= evaluated, practice, quiz
Default = evaluated

formdata.value:
This is a practice situational judgement test that simulates the real test. 

The test has 10 questions and you should aim to complete the test within 10 minutes.

All questions are multiple-choice. 

Make sure you read a question in full before answering.

Answers and explanations to the questions are provided at the end of the test.

GET, POST, OPTIONS, PATCH, PUT, DELETE

formdata.description: Marks alloted to each question in test. Postive decimal values allowed. Default value is 1
Negative marks alloted to each question in test. Postive decimal values allowed without any sign (+ or -). Default value is 0
Passing marks of test. Positive values are allowed without (+ or -) sign. Passing marks can be fixed marks or percentage. Default value is 0.
Passing marks unit. Accepted values are [fixed, percentage]. Default value is fixed
Time alloted in seconds to each question in test. Whole numbers are allowed. Default value is 0 (no time limit)
Time alloted in minutes for overall test. Whole numbers are allowed. Default value is 0 (no time limit). Either time_per_question or test_duration will be applicable at a time
Display the timer. Allowed values [true, false]. Default value is false
Setting for when to show the result to student. Allowed values are [immediately, on_date, manually]
Date on which to release the result. Will be used only when on_date setting is selected above. Default value NULL. Format DD-MM-YYYY HH:MM:SS
Number of attempts for test. Default value is 0. Allowed values are [1, 2, 3...10]
Setting to display question hint on test page
Randomize test questions. Accepted values are [0 and 1]
Randomize answer choices. Accepted values are [0 and 1]
Randomize sub(child) questions within a comprehension question (parent). This setting will be applicable to only comprehension type questions.
Randomize those answer choices which are marked as "fixed" (eg None of the above). Can be set only when "randomize_answer_choices" is 1

request.description:
This API will take two parameters in the URL

1. test guid (required)
2. choices (0, 1)
    

The second parameter choices is for whether answer choices are also needed with the question.

formdata.value:
Please choose the correct answer

You manage a team of 10 people. Your employees are competent and cooperative. However, you noticed that lately they tend to take long coffee breaks and work rates seem slower. You are happy there is a good atmosphere in the office, but feel uncomfortable about the effect it is having on your employees' work.

What would be the best response?
formdata.description: Required. Actual question. Any string value including htm formatting is allowed

Required. Accepted values [mcmc, tf, la, comp
mcmc = Multi Choice
tf = True Flase
la = Essay
comp = Comprehensive

formdata.value: Announce that from now on, any employee who wants to take a break should speak to you first
formdata.description: Aleast 1 answer choice is required.. wysiwyg

formdata.value: Decide that at any given time only one employee can take a coffee break
Discuss the situation with the team and ask for their cooperation
Announce deadlines for each task the team gets, and reprimand employees who dont finish their tasks on time

formdata.description:
Atleast 1 value required. This is the array to indicate correct answer(s). Array keys should match the keys from choice keys above. 
0 or 1
Default ordering will be according to array values ie ,2,3. Array keys should match the keys from choice keys above
Time in seconds. Natural numbers only

request.description:
This API will add a new question in test and return test GUID and question GUID. Input parameters are

**question**: required, string (html allowed)

**question_type**: required, (values- mcmc = Multi Choice, tf = True False, la = Essay, comp = Comprehension)

**feedback**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**answer_feedback**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**marks**: positive integers with float values (0, 1, 2, 3 ...) (0.25, 0.50 etc)

**neg_marks**: positive integers with float values (0, 1, 2, 3 ...) (0.25, 0.50 etc)

**time**: natural numbers (0, 1, 2, 3 ...). \[unit measured in seconds\]

**choice**: required, string (html allowed). Input field must be an array eg

choice\[0\] = {value}

choice\[1\] = {value}

choice\[2\] = {value}

**correct_answer**: at least one required, Allowed values- 0 or 1. Input field must be an array eg

correct_answer\[0\] = {value}

correct_answer\[1\] = {value}

correct_answer\[2\] = {value}

**position**: order of answer choices. Values- 1, 2, 3.... Input field must be an array eg

position\[0\] = {value} 1 or NULL

position\[1\] = {value} 2 or NULL

position\[2\] = {value} 3 or NULL

**status**: 0 = Unpublished, 1 = Published

**created_by**: user guid

formdata.value: What is the capital of Britain?

request.description:
This API will add a new question in test and return test GUID and question GUID. Input parameters are

**question**: required, string (html allowed)

**question_type**: required, (values- mcmc = Multi Choice, tf = True False, la = Essay, comp = Comprehension)

**feedback**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**answer_feedback**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**marks**: positive integers with float values (0, 1, 2, 3 ...) (0.25, 0.50 etc)

**neg_marks**: positive integers with float values (0, 1, 2, 3 ...) (0.25, 0.50 etc)

**time**: natural numbers (0, 1, 2, 3 ...). \[unit measured in seconds\]

**choice**: required, string (html allowed). Input field must be an array eg

choice\[0\] = {value}

choice\[1\] = {value}

choice\[2\] = {value}

**correct_answer**: at least one required, Allowed values- 0 or 1. Input field must be an array eg

correct_answer\[0\] = {value}

correct_answer\[1\] = {value}

correct_answer\[2\] = {value}

**position**: order of answer choices. Values- 1, 2, 3.... Input field must be an array eg

position\[0\] = {value} 1 or NULL

position\[1\] = {value} 2 or NULL

position\[2\] = {value} 3 or NULL

**status**: 0 = Unpublished, 1 = Published

**created_by**: user guid

This API will take two parameters in the URL

1. test guid (required)
2. choices (0, 1)
    

The second parameter choices is for whether answer choices are also needed with the question.
API to remove one question from a test. Required url parameters are **test guid** and **question guid**.
API to remove all questions from a test. Required url parameter is test guid.

This single API can be used to get 3 different types of responses

1. All attempts (with attempt count) by all students in a test
    1. Only parameter required in test guid
2. All attempts by a single student in a test
    1. Two parameters are required: test guid and user guid
3. Single attempt by a single student in a test
    1. Three parameters are required: test guid, user guid and session key

Plz see the examples for more details

request.description:
This single API can be used to get 3 different types of responses

1. All attempts by a single student in a test
    1. Two parameters are required: test guid and user guid
2. Single attempt by a single student in a test
    1. Three parameters are required: test guid, user guid and session key

Plz see the examples for more details

header.value: X-API-KEY, Origin,X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Accept, Access-Control-Requested-Method, Authorization
GET, POST, OPTIONS, PATCH, PUT, DELETE
X-API-KEY, Origin,X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Accept, Access-Control-Requested-Method, Authorization
GET, POST, OPTIONS, PATCH, PUT, DELETE

formdata.description: Guid of the user taking test

request.description:
API to start the test. This API will save the details of user who started the test. Details include-

start time: the time when the test started

submit time: time the test was finally submitted (will be NULL initially)

This API will return **attempt_id**, which will be needed to submit a test

header.value: X-API-KEY, Origin,X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Accept, Access-Control-Requested-Method, Authorization
GET, POST, OPTIONS, PATCH, PUT, DELETE

formdata.value: A mixture of 40 L of alcohol and water contains 10% water. How much water should he added to this mixture so that the new mixture contains 20% water?

formdata.description:
Required. Accepted values [mcmc, tf, la, comp
mcmc = Multi Choice
tf = True Flase
la = Essay
comp = Comprehensive
Aleast 1 answer choice is required.. wysiwyg

Atleast 1 value required. This is the array to indicate correct answer(s). Array keys should match the keys from choice keys above. 
0 or 1
Default ordering will be according to array values ie ,2,3. Array keys should match the keys from choice keys above
Time in seconds. Natural numbers only
Optional. Required only for any sub question for 'comp' type questions

request.description:
This API will add a new question in test and return test GUID and question GUID. Input parameters are

**question**: required, string (html allowed)

**question_type**: required, (values- mcmc = Multi Choice, tf = True False, la = Essay, comp = Comprehension)

**feedback**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**answer_feedback**: string (html allowed), max length 1000 characters

**marks**: positive integers with float values (0, 1, 2, 3 ...) (0.25, 0.50 etc)

**neg_marks**: positive integers with float values (0, 1, 2, 3 ...) (0.25, 0.50 etc)

**time**: natural numbers (0, 1, 2, 3 ...). \[unit measured in seconds\]

**choice**: required, string (html allowed). Input field must be an array eg

choice\[0\] = {value}

choice\[1\] = {value}

choice\[2\] = {value}

**correct_answer**: at least one required, Allowed values- 0 or 1. Input field must be an array eg

correct_answer\[0\] = {value}

correct_answer\[1\] = {value}

correct_answer\[2\] = {value}

**position**: order of answer choices. Values- 1, 2, 3.... Input field must be an array eg

position\[0\] = {value} 1 or NULL

position\[1\] = {value} 2 or NULL

position\[2\] = {value} 3 or NULL

**status**: 0 = Unpublished, 1 = Published

**created_by**: user guid

formdata.value: What is the capital of Britain?

GET, POST, OPTIONS, PATCH, PUT, DELETE

**choice**: required, string (html allowed). Input field must be an array eg

request.description:
This API will take two parameters in the URL

1. question guid (required)
2. choices (0, 1)
    

The second parameter choices is for whether answer choices are also needed with the question.

This API will return **attempt_id**, which will be needed to submit a test

response.name: Single attempt by a signle student in a test (with session-id)

header.value: X-API-KEY, Origin,X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Accept, Access-Control-Requested-Method, Authorization
GET, POST, OPTIONS, PATCH, PUT, DELETE

formdata.description: Guid of the user taking test

request.description:
API to start the test. This API will save the details of user who started the test. Details include-

start time: the time when the test started

submit time: time the test was finally submitted (will be NULL initially)

This API will return **attempt_id**, which will be needed to submit a test

request.description: This API will take GUID as query parameter to find user
This API will return records of all users with roles and other fields. no parameters required

header.value: X-API-KEY, Origin,X-Requested-With, Content-Type, Accept, Access-Control-Requested-Method, Authorization
GET, POST, OPTIONS, PATCH, PUT, DELETE

formdata.description:
[0,1] 
0 = Find those user accounts which are not in recycle bin.
1 = Find those accounts which are in trash

request.description:
This API will return a list of all users based on the search criteria. As input it takes following form parameters:

- **results_per_page** - records to be returned. Used for pagination. Default value is 5
- **search** - text to be searched. Used for a full text search in fields First name, Middle name, Last name, User mobile and User email.
- **page** - page number for pagination. Default value 1.
- **order_by** - accepted values
    - newest_first
    - newest_last
    - last_name_asc
    - last_name_desc
    - first_name_desc
    - first_name_asc - (default)
- **role** - default value is empty. accepted values for role are
    - superadmin,
    - admin
    - student,
    - parent,
    - instructor
- **status** - default value is 1. accepted values are
    - 0 = inactive users
    - 1 = active users

formdata.description: Required. Will contain the mobile number of user
Required. Accepted values = superadmin, admin, instructor, student, parent
Required if set in backend. Will contain the mobile number of user
